result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Marson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No Violent Contact with victim. Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David J Marson in court with Attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ritter makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant make statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

75 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with:  victim

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

***Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department***.
(Fax) ... to adjourn. Filed by Atty Ritter.

Defendant David J Marson in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Andrea W.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant David J Marson in court.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has retained counsel, who was unable to appear today and requests a new court date.  Court adjourns.  
  Arraignment scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
